item.title: Turning
item.description: One common misconception that people have when it comes to blindfolded turning is that the focus is increasing your turning speed and trying to turn as fast as possible, but this is pretty much untrue! If you ever watch top 3x3 blindfolded solvers' solves, you might notice the fast turning, but that’s actually a product of (pretty much) not locking up and pausing. The important part of that sentence that you should strive for is the last part - if you’re not locking up and not pausing, you’ll have an easier time improving your turning.
